clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 3rd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 6 months; assessed with DAS 28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: 'Other limitations of this observational study are the relative low numbers of patients and the high number of missing data.'

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 3rd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Low disease activity (follow up: 6 months; assessed with DAS28 ≤ 3.2)

Risk of bias.rationales: 'Other limitations of this observational study are the relative low numbers of patients and the high number of missing data.'

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 3rd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Disability (follow up: 1 year; assessed with HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22 )

Risk of bias.rationales: 'Other limitations of this observational study are the relative low numbers of patients and the high number of missing data.'

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 3rd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy (follow up: 1 year)

Risk of bias.rationales: 'Other limitations of this observational study are the relative low numbers of patients and the high number of missing data.'

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 3rd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on their 2nd TNF Inhibitor who are not at target
outcome: Withdrawal due to adverse events (follow up: 1 year)

Risk of bias.rationales: 'Other limitations of this observational study are the relative low numbers of patients and the high number of missing data.'

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
